IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ASSOCIATION BRINGS THE WORLD TO OUR LEGENDARY STAGE, ENRICHES LIVES, AND CREATES COMMUNITY THROUGH OUR MISSION TO: (1) PRESERVE THE LEGACY OF THE HISTORIC SHUBERT THEATRE IN NEW HAVEN AS AN ICON OF THE AMERICAN THEATRE BY OPERATING AND EVOLVING OUR THEATRE AS A WORLD CLASS PERFORMING ARTS CENTER; (2) PRESENT INTERNATIONAL, NATIONAL AND LOCAL PROGRAMMING OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY, FEATURING RENOWNED ARTISTS FROM ALL CULTURES AND EMBRACING ALL GENRES OF THE PERFORMING ARTS AND THE DIVERSITY OF OUR LOCAL CULTURE AND COMMUNITY; (3) EDUCATE, INSPIRE, AND BUILD NEW AND DIVERSE AUDIENCES BY OFFERING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS WHICH INTEGRATE THE ARTS INTO OUR COMMUNITY AND BY PROVIDING AFFORDABLE ACCESS TO LIVE PERFORMANCES AT OUR THEATRE; (4) STRENGTHEN OUR ARTS COMMUNITIES THROUGH ADVOCACY, PARTNERSHIP, COLLABORATION, AND MUTUAL SUPPORT; (5) INVIGORATE THE LOCAL ECONOMY THROUGH THE PROGRAMMING WE PRESENT, THE AUDIENCES WE ATTRACT, AND OUR SUPPORT OF THE BUSINESSES IN OUR COMMUNITY
IRS990.Desc: THE ASSOCIATION OWNS AND OPERATES THE SHUBERT THEATRE. OPERATIONS INCLUDE FACILITATION OF RENTAL EVENTS AND MAINTENANCE AND UPKEEP OF THE THEATRE. OVER THE FISCAL YEAR, VARIOUS UPGRADES AND MAINTENANCE WAS PERFORMED ON THE THEATRE INCLUDING REPLACING ALL 1664 SEATS, REMODELING THE VIP SUITE, AND THE REPOINTING OF AGING BRICK ALONG THE FLY LOFT. THERE WERE 21 RENTAL EVENTS IN THE SHUBERT DURING THE FISCAL YEAR THAT SERVED OVER 14,500 PEOPLE WHICH INCLUDED THE TECH REHEARSAL FOR TWO BROADWAY TOURS, "SIX AND "A SOLDIER'S PLAY", AS WELL AS A VARIETY OF OTHER EVENTS AND SHOWS INCLUDING: "NEW HAVEN BALLET'S NUTCRACKER", "HITS! THE MUSICAL", AND A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY-BASED MEETINGS AND SEMINARS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ASSOCIATION PRESENTS EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMERS FROM AROUND THE WORLD, EDUCATING AND ENTERTAINING THE PUBLIC THROUGH PRESENTATIONS THAT SPAN DIVERSE GENRES, INCLUDING THEATRE, MUSIC, COMEDY, DANCE, AND CHILDREN'S PROGRAMMING. THE SHUBERT THEATRE, IN FY23 WELCOMED OVER 50,000 PATRONS TO 30 EVENTS. PRESENTATIONS INCLUDED: "MY FAIR LADY", "BLUE MAN GROUP", "HIP HOP NUTCRACKER", "NATIONAL DANCE THEATRE OF JAMAICA", "BANFF FILM FESTIVAL", AND MORE. THE BROADWAY MUSICAL "BOOK OF MORMON" PERFORMED FOR OVER 7,400 PATRONS MARKING IT AS THE LARGEST AUDIENCE OF THE SEASON.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDES A VARIETY OF EDUCATIONAL AND ARTS OPPORTUNITIES TO STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN THE GREATER NEW HAVEN COMMUNITY. THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE ARTS TO MANY THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE UNABLE TO DO SO. THESE PROGRAMS ARE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH WORKSHOPS, MASTER CLASSES, VISITING ARTIST PROJECTS, AND COMMUNITY TICKET DISTRIBUTIONS. ADDITIONALLY, THE ASSOCIATION IS CONTRACTED BY THE NEW HAVEN BOARD OF EDUCATION TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL SERVICES FOR COOPERATIVE ARTS AND HUMANITIES HIGH SCHOOL'S ARTS PROGRAMS, RELATED THEATRES AND SUPPORT SPACES, ALONG WITH INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS IN USHERING AND TECHNICAL THEATRE. THIS PARTNERSHIP ALSO PROVIDES ALMOST 100 STUDENTS WITH TECHNICAL THEATRE TRAINING AND ALLOWS THEM TO BECOME A WORKFORCE FOR THE SCHOOL. SEE SCHEDULE OTHE STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO TAKE THESE SKILLS ONTO HIGHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS, APPRENTICESHIPS AND JOB OPPORTUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOBBYING ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE CONNECTICUT ASSOCIATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS' MISSION AND CHARITABLE PURPOSE, INCLUDING ARTS PROGRAMMING AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN ASSETS HELD BY OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION HAS ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION (ASC) RELATING TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ASSOCIATION DOES NOT BELIEVE ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

A RELATED ENTITY, THE COLUMBUS ASSOCIATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS, CREATED A 457F NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN FOR ITS PRESIDENT AND CEO, CHAD WHITTINGTON. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, THE RELATED ORGANIZATION CONTRIBUTED $25,000 TO THIS PLAN FOR HIS FUTURE BENEFIT.

CAPA / SHUBERT THEATRE-NEW HAVEN BRINGS THE WORLD TO OUR LEGENDARY STAGE, ENRICHES LIVES, AND CREATES COMMUNITY THROUGH OUR MISSION TO: PRESERVE THE LEGACY OF THE HISTORIC SHUBERT THEATRE IN NEW HAVEN AS AN ICON OF THE AMERICAN THEATRE BY OPERATING AND EVOLVING OUR THEATRE AS A WORLD CLASS PERFORMING ARTS CENTER PRESENT INTERNATIONAL, NATIONAL AND LOCAL PROGRAMMING OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY, FEATURING RENOWNED ARTISTS FROM ALL CULTURES AND EMBRACING ALL GENRES OF THE PERFORMING ARTS AND THE DIVERSITY OF OUR LOCAL CULTURE AND COMMUNITY EDUCATE, INSPIRE, AND BUILD NEW AND DIVERSE AUDIENCES BY OFFERING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS WHICH INTEGRATE THE ARTS INTO OUR COMMUNITY AND BY PROVIDING AFFORDABLE ACCESS TO LIVE PERFORMANCES AT OUR THEATRE STRENGTHEN OUR ARTS COMMUNITIES THROUGH ADVOCACY, PARTNERSHIP, COLLABORATION, AND MUTUAL SUPPORT INVIGORATE THE LOCAL ECONOMY THROUGH THE PROGRAMMING WE PRESENT, THE AUDIENCES WE ATTRACT, AND OUR SUPPORT OF THE BUSINESSES IN OUR COMMUNITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING FISCAL YEAR 2023, THE ASSOCIATION CONTINUED ITS MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH CAPA COLUMBUS. UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, CAPA COLUMBUS PROVIDES CERTAIN MANAGEMENT, FINANCIAL AND MARKETING SERVICES TO THE ASSOCIATION. THE ASSOCIATION'S BOARD CONTINUES TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND STRATEGIC DIRECTION TO BOTH THE ASSOCIATION'S STAFF AND THE STAFF AT CAPA COLUMBUS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLUMBUS ASSOCIATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ASSOCIATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COLUMBUS ASSOCIATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS, THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ASSOCIATION, HAS AUTHORITY OVER THE ELECTION AND APPOINTMENT OF THE DIRECTORS OF THE GOVERNING BODY, AS WELL AS THE AUTHORITY TO REMOVE THE DIRECTORS AT ANY TIME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AFTER MANAGEMENT REVIEWS ARE COMPLETE, A DRAFT OF THE 990 IS DISTRIBUTED VIA E-MAIL TO THE FULL BOARD OF THE ASSOCIATION FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT. THE 990 IS MODIFIED BASED ON BOARD COMMENTS/QUESTIONS AS NEEDED. A FINAL DRAFT IS RE-DISTRIBUTED PRIOR TO FILING OF THE 990 WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS DETERMINED BY THE CEO OF THE COLUMBUS ASSOCIATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS, SOLE MEMBER OF THE ASSOCIATION. INDUSTRY SPECIFIC PAY DATA FROM OTHER PERFORMING ARTS ORGANIZATIONS AND SALARY GUIDES ARE USED AS A GUIDEPOST TO DETERMINE REASONABLENESS OF PAY. PAY OF OTHERS WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO CONSIDERED WHEN DETERMINING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY. PAY CHANGES ARE BASED ON PERFORMANCE AS WELL AS CHANGES (INCREASE OR DECREASE) IN THE AMOUNT AND LEVEL OF WORK PERFORMED. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT COMPENSATE ANY OTHER OFFICERS AND DOES NOT HAVE ANY KEY EMPLOYEES, BUT WOULD ADOPT A SIMILAR PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION IF THEY DO IN THE FUTURE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORMS 990 AND 1023 ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST. FURTHER, THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION ON ANOTHER'S WEBSITE, WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND POLICIES ARE GENERALLY NOT PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC, OTHER THAN THOSE REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED BY LAW. ANNUAL FINANCIAL RESULTS ARE SUMMARIZED IN AN ANNUAL REPORT THAT IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA OUR WEBSITE OR UPON REQUEST.
GAIN (LOSS) IN BENEFICIAL INTERESTS HELD BY OTHERS 297,934.
THE PROCESS REMAINS UNCHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
